trans-unit.source: This topic walks through a utility function that registers background tasks.
trans-unit.target: This topic walks through a utility function that registers background tasks.

trans-unit.source: This utility function checks for existing registrations first before registering the task multiple times to avoid problems with multiple registrations, and it can apply a system condition to the background task.
trans-unit.target: This utility function checks for existing registrations first before registering the task multiple times to avoid problems with multiple registrations, and it can apply a system condition to the background task.

trans-unit.source: The walkthrough includes a complete, working example of this utility function.
trans-unit.target: The walkthrough includes a complete, working example of this utility function.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows apps must call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) before registering any of the background trigger types.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows apps must call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) before registering any of the background trigger types.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call [**RemoveAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700471) and then call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) when your app launches after being updated.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call [**RemoveAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700471) and then call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) when your app launches after being updated.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Guidelines for background tasks](guidelines-for-background-tasks.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Guidelines for background tasks](guidelines-for-background-tasks.md).

trans-unit.source: Check for existing registrations
trans-unit.target: Check for existing registrations

trans-unit.source: Check whether the task is already registered.
trans-unit.target: Check whether the task is already registered.

trans-unit.source: It's important to check this because if a task is registered multiple times, it will run more than once whenever it’s triggered; this can use excess CPU and may cause unexpected behavior.
trans-unit.target: It's important to check this because if a task is registered multiple times, it will run more than once whenever it’s triggered; this can use excess CPU and may cause unexpected behavior.

trans-unit.source: You can check for existing registrations by querying the [**BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224787) property and iterating on the result.
trans-unit.target: You can check for existing registrations by querying the [**BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224787) property and iterating on the result.

trans-unit.source: Check the name of each instance – if it matches the name of the task you’re registering, then break out of the loop and set a flag variable so that your code can choose a different path in the next step.
trans-unit.target: Check the name of each instance – if it matches the name of the task you’re registering, then break out of the loop and set a flag variable so that your code can choose a different path in the next step.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Use background task names that are unique to your app.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Use background task names that are unique to your app.

trans-unit.source: Ensure each background task has a unique name.
trans-unit.target: Ensure each background task has a unique name.
